title: Upload Single Image to Bug Report
description: Verify that a user can upload a single image when creating a new bug report
preconditions: 1. User is logged in as SUPER_ADMIN or DEVELOPER|2. User has access to create bug reports|3. User has a valid image file (PNG, JPG, GIF)
test_steps: 1. Navigate to Development > Bugs > New Bug Report|2. Fill in required fields (Title, Description, Severity, Priority)|3. Click on Screenshot file upload field|4. Select a single image file|5. Complete remaining fields|6. Click Create Bug Report
expected_result: 1. File upload field accepts the image|2. Image filename is displayed below upload field|3. Bug report is created successfully|4. Success message appears|5. Navigated to bug detail page|6. Uploaded image is displayed in the Screenshots section|7. Image can be clicked to view full size

title: Upload Multiple Images to Feature Request
description: Verify that a user can upload multiple images when creating a feature request
preconditions: 1. User is logged in with can_create_features permission|2. User has multiple image files ready
test_steps: 1. Navigate to Development > Features > New Feature Request|2. Fill in Title and Description|3. Scroll to Images section|4. Click on the file upload field|5. Select multiple images|6. Complete remaining required fields|7. Click Create Feature Request
expected_result: 1. All selected images are listed below upload field|2. Feature request is created successfully|3. Navigated to feature detail page|4. All images are displayed in grid format|5. Each image can be clicked to view full size|6. Each image has a delete button on hover

title: Delete Image from Feature Request
description: Verify that users can delete images from feature requests
preconditions: 1. Feature request exists with 2+ images uploaded|2. User has edit permission
test_steps: 1. Navigate to feature detail page|2. Scroll to Images section|3. Hover over one of the images|4. Click the red X delete button|5. Confirm deletion in popup|6. Page refreshes
expected_result: 1. Confirmation dialog appears|2. After confirmation image is removed from display|3. Other images remain visible|4. Image file is deleted from server|5. Success message displayed

title: Mention User in Comment with Autocomplete
description: Verify that typing @ in a comment triggers username autocomplete
preconditions: 1. User is logged in|2. User is viewing a bug report detail page|3. Multiple users exist in the system
test_steps: 1. Navigate to a bug report detail page|2. Scroll to Comments section|3. Click in the comment text box|4. Type @ symbol|5. Type first few letters of a username|6. Click on a suggested username|7. Type additional comment text|8. Click Post Comment
expected_result: 1. Autocomplete dropdown appears after typing @|2. Dropdown shows list of matching usernames|3. As more letters are typed list filters|4. Clicking a username inserts @username into comment|5. @username appears with special formatting|6. Comment posts successfully with mention intact|7. Mentioned user appears as clickable link

title: Email Notification Sent to Mentioned User
description: Verify that mentioned users receive email notifications
preconditions: 1. Two users exist User A and User B|2. User B has valid email address|3. User A is logged in|4. Email system is configured
test_steps: 1. User A navigates to a bug report|2. User A adds a comment with @userB|3. User A posts the comment|4. Check User B email inbox
expected_result: 1. Email is sent to User B within 1 minute|2. Email subject includes Bug ID|3. Email body contains who mentioned them and comment text|4. Email has direct link to the bug report|5. Email is properly formatted

title: Access Feedback Page as CLIENT User
description: Verify that CLIENT users can access the feedback bug report page
preconditions: 1. User account exists with user_type = CLIENT|2. User is logged in
test_steps: 1. Log in as CLIENT user|2. Navigate to homepage|3. Look for Feedback card|4. Click on Report a Bug link|5. Observe the page that loads
expected_result: 1. Feedback card is visible on homepage|2. Card shows Report a Bug and My Reports links|3. Clicking Report a Bug navigates to /feedback/report-bug|4. Bug report form loads successfully|5. Form has simplified fields|6. Info banner explains purpose

title: Submit Bug Report as COUNTRY_ADMIN
description: Verify COUNTRY_ADMIN can successfully submit a bug report
preconditions: 1. User is logged in as COUNTRY_ADMIN|2. User has valid bug information to report
test_steps: 1. Navigate to /feedback/report-bug|2. Fill in Title|3. Fill in Description|4. Upload a screenshot|5. Select Severity and Priority|6. Fill in Component|7. Fill in Steps to Reproduce|8. Click Submit Bug Report
expected_result: 1. All fields accept input correctly|2. Form submits successfully|3. Success message displayed|4. Redirected to My Reports page|5. New bug appears at top of list|6. Bug status shows as Open|7. Bug is visible to SUPER_ADMIN in development bugs page
test_data: Test bug: Login button not working

title: View My Reports as SUPERVISOR
description: Verify SUPERVISOR users can view their own submitted bug reports
preconditions: 1. SUPERVISOR user has submitted 3 bug reports previously|2. Other users have also submitted bugs
test_steps: 1. Log in as SUPERVISOR user|2. Navigate to homepage|3. Click on Feedback card My Reports|4. Observe the page content
expected_result: 1. Page title My Bug Reports|2. Shows count 3 Reports Submitted|3. Table displays only the 3 bugs submitted by this user|4. Each row shows Title Status Severity Priority Submitted date|5. Other users bugs are NOT visible|6. Status badges are color-coded|7. Each bug has a View button

title: Cannot View Other Users Bug Reports
description: Verify users cannot view bug reports submitted by other users
preconditions: 1. CLIENT User A submitted bug report with ID 100|2. CLIENT User B is logged in|3. User B knows the URL /feedback/bug/100
test_steps: 1. Log in as User B|2. Attempt to access /feedback/bug/100|3. Observe the response
expected_result: 1. Access is denied|2. Error message displayed|3. Redirected back to My Reports|4. User B can only see their own submitted bugs|5. Security check prevents unauthorized access

title: Required Fields Validation on Submit
description: Verify that required fields are validated before submission
test_steps: 1. Leave Title field empty|2. Fill in Description|3. Click Submit Bug Report|4. Observe validation|5. Fill in Title|6. Clear Description field|7. Click Submit again
expected_result: 1. Form does not submit when Title is empty|2. Browser validation message appears on Title|3. Red border highlights empty required field|4. After filling Title but clearing Description validation message appears|5. Form only submits when both Title and Description are filled
